sentences: A telephone, or phone, is a <<||>> device that permits two or more users to <<||>> a conversation when they are too far apart to be heard directly. A telephone <<||>> sound, typically and most efficiently the human voice, into electronic <<||>> suitable for transmission via cables or other transmission media over long <<||>>, and replays such signals <<||>> in audible form to its user. In 1876, Scottish <<||>> Alexander Graham Bell was the first to be granted a United States <<||>> for a device that produced clearly intelligible replication of the human voice. This instrument was further <<||>> by many others. The telephone was the first device in history that <<||>> people to talk directly with each other across large distances. Telephones rapidly became <<||>> to businesses, government, and <<||>>, and are today some of the most widely used small appliances. The <<||>> telephones were directly connected to each other from one customer's office or residence to another customer's location. Being <<||>> beyond just a few customers, these systems were quickly replaced by <<||>> operated centrally located switchboards. Telephones permit <<||>>, meaning they allow the people on both ends to talk simultaneously. Via wikipedia.org.
